person.persName: Ebenezer Dumont (Union Army general, US Representative)

body.p: Lawyer, US Representative from Indiana, general in the Union Army. Vevay, Switzerland County, Indiana native. Son of John and Julia Cory Dumont. Married to Mary Ann Cheek Dumont on April 18, 1839. Father of Mary Fannie Dumont, Julia Louisa Dumont, Cornelia Cory Dumont, Martha E. Dumont, Clinton Charles Dumont, Isabella Anna Dumont, Anna Dumont, Jessie Virginia Dumont and Eugenia Dumont. Graduate of the University of Indiana. Served in the Indiana State House of Representatives in 1838 and from 1850 to 1853. Served as a Lieutenant Colonel in the Mexican War. Appointed Colonel in the 7th Regiment Indiana Volunteer Infantry on April 27, 1861, promoted to Brigadier General in September 1861. In 1862, commanded both 17th Brigade and 12th Division of the Army of the Ohio, during Braxton Braggâ€™s invasion of Kentucky. Resigned from the army when elected to the US House of Representatives, serving from 1863 to 1867.
